title: How can someone use call-only Bluetooth in a car to play music with their phone? - Quora

response.answer_text: You don’t. Because it will sound like listening to the music thorough a tin can… Instead, you need either an Aux cable or a Bluetooth receiver, which allows you to pipe music through your radio’s aux input. The Bluetooth receiver can use the A2DP profile to play music from the phone, while allowing your HandsFree profile to take over when the phone rings. If your radio doesn’t have an aux input, then you should look at a cassette adapter or an FM modulator that hooks up to your antenna cable and feeds the signal directly to the radio. You can get cassette adapters with built-in Bluetooth, or you can connect a BT receiver to the cassette adapter’s input cable.

Your car if it’s older, probably only supports the HFP ‘Handsfree’ profile and your phone is probably looking for something with a A2DP ‘Audio Distribution’ profile. If you can get your phone to pipe music to a monaural Bluetooth headset, it should be able to send it to the car, but you probably won’t be impressed with the audio quality (it’s voice-quality monaural) See the specs at: List of Bluetooth profiles - Wikipedia
